title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files and can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When creating a new project for an existing directory structure with the output folder set to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, the system does not confirm if the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: The system should display a confirmation message to the user, asking if they want to proceed with deleting and rebuilding the output directory.
SR:
1. Go to the project creation page.
2. Select an existing directory structure.
3. Set the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files.
4. Attempt to create the project.
5. Verify that a confirmation message is displayed, asking if the user wants to proceed with deleting and rebuilding the output directory.
